channel.title: Making a Standard server using mopar
channel.description:
ive been looking through some of the tutorials. # i CAN portforward # i CAN download a source # i NEED help to start off a server on mopar # i'm a COMPLETE ROOKIE So what do i need to do to connect to my server using mopar? Can you right it in step by step? e.g:
# Goto Mopar # Check portforward # ...etc
and if i just create one ( ' start server ' button on mopar client ) does that start a server off and what commands and stuff does it give? Sorry im a noob at RSPSs'

item.title: Making a Standard server using mopar
item.dc:creator: @GN_Editz GN Editz
item.description:
@GN_Editz wrote:

[quote=“go armand, post:6, topic:410979”]Find what jdk version you have.

See where it says jdk1.6.0_21
That ‘21’ at the end is the jdk version

You need to change it to the version that you currently have otherwise it wont be able to find the path.
To see which version you have,
go to computer>localdisk (c:)>ProgramFiles>Java
when you’re in there. You’ll see a file called Jdk1.6.0_(SOME NUMBER)
might be 20, 19, 22, 23, 24.
Then this number is the one where you go back to your compiler code and change it to.

If you don’t have a jdk folder. you’ll need to download it from java and then do the same process i just showed you.

If it doesn’t work, then try setting your environment variables.
don’t ask me how to do that, i’m not very good at it…
but watch youtube. there are heaps of tuts.[/quote]

Ok thanks mate. Your awsome you can have free donator if i get it to work.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a Standard server using mopar
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

Find what jdk version you have.

See where it says jdk1.6.0_21
That ‘21’ at the end is the jdk version

You need to change it to the version that you currently have otherwise it wont be able to find the path.
To see which version you have,
go to computer>localdisk (c:)>ProgramFiles>Java
when you’re in there. You’ll see a file called Jdk1.6.0_(SOME NUMBER)
might be 20, 19, 22, 23, 24.
Then this number is the one where you go back to your compiler code and change it to.

If you don’t have a jdk folder. you’ll need to download it from java and then do the same process i just showed you.

If it doesn’t work, then try setting your environment variables.
don’t ask me how to do that, i’m not very good at it…
but watch youtube. there are heaps of tuts.

item.description:
@GN_Editz wrote:

When i put it into the client source (i found the ip part)

i’ve put in my ip and then i save and go to compile…
Im on a 64 bit system
and it says no specific path. Why does it say this?

Here is the compiler code:

@echo off Title Compiler cd Gian "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_21\bin\javac.exe" *.java pause

item.title: Making a Standard server using mopar
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

Automatic.
Your client just runs off the server ip you put into it.
and your source is where you run the ip.
WHen you play other peopls servers. You’re just connecting with the client and they’re hosting.

Read full topic

Source: http://pastebin.com/rgMLvWJ9

Can you up ’ IPHERE ’ for where i need to put the ip please?

Read full topic
item.source: Making a Standard server using mopar

item.title: Making a Standard server using mopar
item.dc:creator: @go_armand go armand
item.description:
@go_armand wrote:

You can portfoward.
This is good,
Open it to port : 43594.

Then, go to www.no-ip.com and register.
and create a host.
eg, wankshit.no-ip.biz.

Then download duc 3.0 from the same website. Open it, and click the host you want to be open.
(wankshit.no-ip.biz)

Now, you’re going to need a source AND client. I STRONGLY RECOMMEND PI. (project insanity)
Your source automatically runs on port 43594.
Download a client that’s compatible with your source.
(just download the client and source from the same post in server downloads)

Then, if you’ve chosen PI.
go into client.java in your client files that you just downloaded.
and find server =“127.0.0.1” or server = “0.0.0.0”
then change that to server =“wankshit.no-ip.biz”

now, if you run your source.
your client should connect onto wankshit.no-ip.biz!

and ya done
if you then send that client to others.
they can connect too.

also, with regards to commands.
thats why i recommend PI.
cause PI is what most people use. And there are heaps of commands out there.
i’d be happy to share mine with you if you want.
hope this heplped a litt.e

Read full topic
